name: zephyr-workbench
description: Zephyr project support for Visual Studio Code - previously Zephyr Workbench

zephyr-workbench.pathToEnvScript.markdownDescription: Set the path to the environment script to configure the Zephyr environment.

zephyr-workbench.venv.activatePath.description: Deprecated: path to the Python virtual environment activation script.

zephyr-workbench.venv.path.description: Path to your Python virtual environment directory (root). Leave empty to use the default internal environment.

zephyr-workbench.listSDKs.description: List of paths which point to Zephyr SDK supported on Zephyr Workbench

zephyr-workbench.listIARs.description:
List of registered IAR ARM Toolchain entries.
Each entry is an object { "zephyrSdkPath": "...", "iarPath": "...", "token": "..." }

zephyr-workbench.westWorkspace.description: The path to the attached west workspace

zephyr-workbench.sdk.description: The path to the Zephyr SDK that provide toolchains

zephyr-workbench.toolchain.description: Which toolchain to use for the project: 'zephyr_sdk' or 'iar'

zephyr-workbench.iar.description:
Per-workspace override for which IAR toolchain to use.
Must be one of the objects defined in zephyr-workbench.listIARs.

zephyr-workbench.build.pristine.description: The option controls whether the build directory is made pristine before the build.

zephyr-workbench.build.west-args.description: User additional args to west command

zephyr-workbench.sysbuildEnabled.description: When enabled, the --sysbuild flag will be appended to West build commands.

default-runner.description: Preferred west runner for this configuration (used for Run/Flash without prompting)

west-args.description: User additional args to west command

sysbuild.description: When true, the --sysbuild flag will be appended to west build commands.

env.FILE_SUFFIX.description: Optional suffix for filenames that will be added to Kconfig fragments and devicetree overlays

zephyr-workbench-activitybar.name: West workspaces
zephyr-workbench-activitybar.contextualTitle: west workspaces with Zephyr sources and modules

viewsWelcome.contents:
Import the Zephyr sources from [Github](https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr) or enter your local sources and initialize your workspace
[Initialize workspace](command:zephyr-workbench-west-workspace.open-wizard)

view/item/context.when: (view == zephyr-workbench-west-workspace && viewItem == west-workspace-env) || (view == zephyr-workbench-app-explorer && viewItem == zephyr-application-env)
(view == zephyr-workbench-west-workspace && viewItem == west-workspace-env-value) || (view == zephyr-workbench-app-explorer && viewItem == zephyr-application-env-value)
(view == zephyr-workbench-west-workspace && viewItem == west-workspace-env-value) || (view == zephyr-workbench-app-explorer && viewItem == zephyr-application-env-value)

config.description: The name of the build configuration

cwd.description: Working folder. By default, the root of the workspace folder

env.markdownDescription: Additional environment variables with the format "name": "value".

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
